Employee Spotlight

Bety Tichauer – Sao Paulo

Bety's manager, Luis Cassio de Oliveira , had this to say about Bety Tichauer:

"Since Bety has almost 16 years in the organization, she is a great source of information for the whole marketing team, with proficiency in business acumen and brand stewardship. She and her team have also fully incorporated the Visa Way of Marketing since its implementation, leading the affluent projects in Brazil guided by its principles. She is also a great team player, always trying to encourage teamwork inside and outside her team.

She was the first intern in the Visa do Brazil office and since then made a strategic stop in the Mexico City, where she got married and continued working at the Visa office for four years until moving back to Brazil. She just arrived from maternity leave for her second child, Arthur, and since then she is focused on developing her outstanding competence."

Q. What motivates you to come to work every day?

A. I love the work I do. I'm passionate about Marketing and everything that involves communication. Besides the work itself, I have to say that I'm very motivated to come to work every day because of the GREAT team I'm part of. I can easily say that some of my very good friends work here next to me, this makes my day really pleasant.

Q. Can you provide an example of someone at Visa who has modeled flexible leadership – and the impact this person had on your work?

A. In 2011 and 2012 we had a great opportunity to work closely with Kevin Burke. He acted as LAC Head while the company was looking for a replacement for this position. In a very short period of time I learned so many things from him as leader. He showed us new and better ways to do our jobs, not only our own work but with our teams and agency partners. The biggest lesson I learned is that a true leader listens to their team with open ears and an open heart.

Q. What is your favorite Visa Marketing Asset and why?

A. My favorite asset is Visa's Brand Strategy. Now, that we have been using this tool for more than three years I've incorporated it throughout my work, in all steps of the communication process, from brief to approvals to evaluation. It is a great guide to see if we are going in the right direction.

Q. Can you share insights you're seeing on the ground in Brazil in prep for the Confederations Cup this summer?

A. We are starting to see the spirit of soccer around the country. There is a lot of buzz around the Confederations Cup. Sponsors are on air with their campaigns, people are talking about the possibility of Brazil being the champion, sharing opinions about the best players and the best teams, as well as making arrangements to watch the games. The fun is just starting.

Q. Which Social Media outlet do you use the most?

A. I use Facebook a lot, personally and for work. Since I have friends outside Brazil, and in different cities in Brazil, and since my "in laws" are from Mexico, it is a great tool to keep connected with them. I'm constantly uploading pictures of my kids, telling them about great places I go, sharing our vacation pictures, etc. I also use Facebook professionally to follow companies I admire and to see what competitors are doing socially.

Q. What has been your most memorable purchase with your Visa?

A. I have to say that my most memorable purchase with Visa was my one-way ticket to Mexico. I got married in 2004 and my husband (who is Mexican) and I moved to Mexico. I still remember looking at the computer screen with my card in hand and clicking on the one-way ticket option. I knew that was not a simple purchase...it represented the biggest change in my life.
